title: 2 Easy Ways to Change Your Primary Email Address on Facebook

steps.title: Open the Facebook App and tap ☰.
steps.content: Open the Facebook App and tap ☰ . On an iPhone or iPad, this will be at the bottom-right corner. On Android, this will be at the top-right corner. [1] X Research source Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . This will be at the very bottom, next to the cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . You can find this at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . It's near the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Personal details.
steps.content: Tap Personal details . It's under the "Account settings" header.

steps.title: Tap Contact info.
steps.content: Tap Contact info . This option is at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Add new contact.
steps.content: Tap Add new contact .

steps.title: Tap Add email.
steps.content: Tap Add email .

steps.title: Enter your new email address.
steps.content: Enter your new email address. Type the new email address into the field at the top.

steps.title: Select your account(s) and tap Next.
steps.content: Select your account(s) and tap Next . If you have multiple accounts linked, you can select which ones to apply the new email address to. Once you tap Next , a confirmation code will be sent to your new email address.

steps.title: Confirm your confirmation code.
steps.content: Confirm your confirmation code. Once confirmed, your new email address will be linked to your Facebook account. This should return you to the Contact Information screen. If it doesn't, tap the back button to return there now. If you want, you can keep both email addresses connected to your Facebook account and use either to log in. But if you won't be using that email address anymore, you can continue with this method to delete it.

steps.title: Delete your old email address.
steps.content: Delete your old email address. If you don't want to keep your old email address connected to your Facebook account, tap it on the Contact Information screen, select Delete email , and follow the on-screen instructions to remove it.

steps.title: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner of Facebook.
steps.content: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner of Facebook. This will open a menu. If you aren't logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password before proceeding. If needed, you can recover your password .

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . You can find this below your profile name.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This will open your account settings.

steps.title: Click Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click Accounts Center . It's in the upper-left corner of the page.

steps.title: Click Personal details.
steps.content: Click Personal details . It's on the left panel.

steps.title: Click Contact info.
steps.content: Click Contact info . This is at the top of the right panel. Any email addresses and phone numbers connected to your account will appear here.

steps.title: Click Add new contact.
steps.content: Click Add new contact . Before you remove your old email address, we'll first add your new one.

steps.title: Select Add email.
steps.content: Select Add email .

steps.title: Enter your email address.
steps.content: Enter your email address.

steps.title: Select your Facebook account(s) and click Next.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account(s) and click Next . If you have more than one Meta account (such as an Instagram account or a second Facebook account), you can add the new email address to as many of these accounts as you'd like. Once you click Next , you'll receive a code to your new email address. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Confirm your new email address.
steps.content: Confirm your new email address. Enter the code you received via email, click Next , and then click Close . Your new primary email address is now available on Facebook. If you want, you can keep both email addresses connected to your Facebook account and use either to log in. But if you won't be using that email address anymore, you can continue with this method to delete it.

steps.title: Delete your old email address.
steps.content: Delete your old email address. If you don't want to keep your old email address associated with your Facebook account, click to select it on the Contact Info screen, click Delete email , and follow the on-screen instructions to remove it from Facebook.
